definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
mark/sign/talisman/to seal/to correspond to/tally/symbol/written charm/to coincide

sentences.english: It uses the standard mnemonics for JVM opcodes as instruction names.
sentences.chinese: 它用了jvm標準的操作碼助記符名稱。

sentences.english: Many of them use a mnemonic method.
sentences.chinese: 他們中很多人都是用了助記符的方法。

sentences.english: If a mnemonic parameter is provided, then the component's mnemonic is set.
sentences.chinese: 如果提供了助記符參數，則設置組件的助記符。

sentences.english: If a mnemonic parameter is provided, then the component's mnemonic is set.
sentences.chinese: 如果提供了助記符參數，則設置組件的助記符。

sentences.english: The process of writing instructions in a programming language.
sentences.chinese: 程序員爲每一條機器指令寫一條助記符指令。

sentences.english: The programmer writes one mnemonic (memory-aiding) instruction for each machine-level instruction.
sentences.chinese: 程序員爲每一條機器指令寫一條助記符指令。
